text: eyebrow - Sparse eyelashes - Sparse scalp hair - Sudanophilic leukodystrophy - Thin ribs - Truncal ataxia - Upslanted palpebral fissure - Widely patent fontanelles and sutures - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimate of the percentage of patients who have that feature. T
